lexUnit.name: pinch.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: grip (the flesh) tightly and sharply between finger and thumb.

sentence.text: Brownlow pinched his lip between finger and thumb .
He wiped the scattered crumbs on his tray to a neat heap and then pinched them between his fingers and gobbled them .
PINCH flabby areas gently between your thumb and fingers .
He was pinching her arm in his excitement , turning for a moment when she complained .

I held out a hand , and she pinched it with tiny , black-gloved fingers .
Jean pinched the muscle just below the shoulder and stuck the needle in .
The elderly lady looked up through her miasma of smoke and pinched her face into a tight little smile .
